faqs.question: What is IMU-CET and why is it important?
faqs.answer: IMU-CET (Indian Maritime University Common Entrance Test) is the standardized entrance exam for admission to IMU and affiliated maritime colleges. It tests aptitude in Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics and General Knowledge. Score determines merit-based selection.

faqs.question: What is the exam pattern and syllabus?
faqs.answer: IMU-CET is objective type MCQ exam. Duration: 2 hours. Total marks: 200. Syllabus covers 10+2 level Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics, English and General Knowledge. No negative marking.

faqs.question: What is the application process for IMU-CET?
faqs.answer: Application done online through IMU website. Eligibility: 10+2 Science pass. Registration fee applies. Exam conducted twice yearly. Results declared within 30 days of exam.
